questiontext.text: In _________ computing a program's statements are run in order, one at a time.
Why is synchronization important in parallel computing?

answer.text: To make sure memory is not overloaded
To prevent conflicts when multiple processors access shared data

questiontext.text: Suppose you run a program on one core and it takes 6 minutes. Then you run it on 3 cores and it takes 3 minutes. What is the speedup?

answer.text: Cannot be determined from the information given

questiontext.text: Suppose that a computational task that normally takes 60 minutes to execute can be broken up into equal parts and run in parallel on 16 different processors. About how long would it take to compute?
What type of computing involves multiple computers solving a problem by working together over a network?
Which of the following best describes Sequential Computing?

answer.text: Two computational tasks being run at the same time on different processors.
Computational tasks are scheduled to execute in an optimal order.
Each computational task is executed from start to finish before another task can start.
Computational tasks are assigned to different computers so they can all be run independently.

questiontext.text: What is the main objective of parallel computing?

answer.text: Improve computation speed by executing tasks simultaneously

questiontext.text: Which of the following best illustrates **Asynchronous Computing**?

answer.text: Task A runs in one window while task B runs in a different window
Task A runs and once completed, then task B runs
Task A runs for a while, then pauses and allows Task B to execute, then resumes once Task B has completed
Tasks A and B run on different computers at the same time

questiontext.text: Which of the following best illustrates **Parallel Computing**?

answer.text: Task A runs on computer X while Task B runs on computer Y, once both have completed, they report their results back to computer Z
Task B runs after Task A has been completed
Task A runs on Processor X at the same time as Task B runs on Processor Y
Task A runs for a while, then pauses and allows Task B to execute, then resumes once Task B has completed

questiontext.text: Consider the following task in a program: Each element of an array stores the price for the inventory of a store. It is necessary for the store to add 9% to the price of each item. Is this a task that can be parallelized?

answer.text: No, processors could access the same memory but not in this case
Yes, different processors could operate on different parts of the array at the same time
No, processors cannot share the same memory
Yes, copies of the array could be distributed to each processor

questiontext.text: Which of the following best describes a distributed system?
What is one major benefit of parallel computing?
What is an *event* in the context of event-driven programming?

answer.text: A block of code that runs continuously in a loop
A specific programming language used for web-development
A signal that something has happened such as a user clicking a mouse
A type of variable used to store numerical data

questiontext.text: Which of the following best describes **Asynchronous Computing**?

answer.text: A task can begin executing without waiting for other tasks to finish, and may be resumed later
Multiple tasks are executed simultaneously using multiple processors
Tasks are executed one at a time, waiting for each to finish before starting the next
All tasks must be completed in the order they were started

questiontext.text: Which of the following best describes **Parallel Computing**

answer.text: A task is paused until all other tasks have completed
One task runs while others wait their turn to execute
Tasks are broken into smaller sub-tasks that are processed at the same time using multiple processors or cores
Tasks are executed one at a time on a single processor in a fixed sequence

questiontext.text: _______ computing is writing software that takes advantage of a multiprocessor's ability to do processing on multiple cores simultaneously.
What is a distributed system?

answer.text: A system with multiple CPUs sharing the same memory
A collection of independent computers that appear as a single system

questiontext.text: ________ computing is when a problem is divided into smaller parts that are executed on multiple networked computers.
Which of the following best describes **Distributed Computing**

answer.text: Tasks run in the background without blocking the main program
A single computer with multiple cores runs multiple tasks at the same time
A single task is executed sequentially on one machine
A task is divided and executed across multiple networked computers that communicate and coordinate with each other

questiontext.text: ___________ computing involves a single processor rapidly switching between tasks, giving the illusion of simultaneous execution.
Which of the following could be considered a parallel task?

answer.text: Grading multiple exams at once with different people

questiontext.text: Suppose we run a computational task in parallel on 32 different processors, each taking 2 minutes to run. If we were to run the same task in serial, about how long would it take to compute?
In distributed computing, how are the computing nodes typically connected?
Which of the following is a challenge in distributed computing?
Which of the following is a common goal of parallel programming?

answer.text: Making computations faster by using multiple processors

questiontext.text: Which of the following is the best example of **Distributed Computing**

answer.text: An operating system distributing its execution time to multiple processes
A team of software engineers working remotely across the globe
Breaking up a computational task so that it can be run on multiple processors

questiontext.text: What does it mean if a program is 'parallelizable'?

answer.text: It can be compressed into a smaller file
It can be divided into parts to run simultaneously
It uses a single thread of execution
It can be run by multiple users at once

questiontext.text: What happens when too many processors are added to a task with a large serial portion?
Which of the following is the best example of **Asynchronous Computing**?

answer.text: A browser loading more messages in the background while you type a response
An email program running on a web browser
A complex 3D animation scene being rendered on multiple servers
A program that searches a file for a particular keyword

questiontext.text: Which of the following best describes **Distributed Computing**?

answer.text: A computer distributing work over a longer period of time to avoid overheating
Multiple computers or devices working together over a network to solve a problem
A single computer splitting a problem into different parts and solving each one on different processors
Multiple software developers working in different locations on a software project

questiontext.text: Which of the following is the best example of **Sequential Computing**?

answer.text: A team of software engineers designs one part of a system before designing another part
Task A starts then pauses to wait for a network connection, allowing task B to start
Tasks A, B, and C are analyzed to determine the optimal order of execution
Task A starts and completes before task B can start
